description: High-difficulty logical reasoning scenarios involving complex sporting rules, multi-way tiebreakers, and counter-intuitive outcomes

scenarios.title: La Liga 2020-21 Three-Way Relegation Tiebreaker
scenarios.scenario_question: If Eibar wins on final day against Barcelona, and Huesca and Elche both lose, all three would be on 33 points. Who gets relegated?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Two-way tiebreaker: Huesca holds H2H over Elche (3-1, 0-0)
logical_breakdown.step_2: Two-way tiebreaker: Huesca tied with Eibar on H2H (1-1, 1-1), but better GD
logical_breakdown.step_3: Two-way tiebreaker: Elche holds H2H over Eibar (1-0, 1-0)
logical_breakdown.step_4: But if THREE-WAY tie at 33 points, construct mini-table
logical_breakdown.step_5: Three-way mini-table: Elche 7 pts, Huesca 6 pts, Eibar 2 pts
logical_breakdown.step_6: Elche survives in 3-way tie despite losing 2-way to Huesca

scenarios.answer: In two-way tie: Huesca > Elche. In three-way tie: Elche > Huesca > Eibar. The addition of Eibar reverses the ranking between Huesca and Elche.
scenarios.why_complex: Counter-intuitive outcome where adding a third team reverses the ranking of the other two due to mini-table construction rules

scenarios.title: Serie A 2004-05 Relegation Playoff
scenarios.scenario_question: Three teams finished on 42 points. How was relegation determined?

logical_breakdown.step_2: Fiorentina: 8 pts (W2 D2 L0), GF 3-1, GD +2
logical_breakdown.step_3: Bologna: 7 pts (W2 D1 L1), GF 5-3, GD +2
logical_breakdown.step_4: Parma: 1 pt (W0 D1 L3), GF 3-7, GD -4
logical_breakdown.step_6: Bologna vs Parma playoff: Parma won 2-1 on aggregate

scenarios.answer: Fiorentina survived via classifica avulsa (8 pts), Parma survived via playoff (beat Bologna 2-1 aggregate), Bologna relegated
scenarios.why_complex: Bologna had best goal-scoring record in mini-table (5-3) but still relegated due to H2H points taking precedence, then losing playoff

scenarios.title: 2018 World Cup Fair Play Tiebreaker
scenarios.scenario_question: Japan and Senegal are tied on points, goal difference, goals scored, and drew 2-2 head-to-head. Who advances?
scenarios.answer: Japan advances on fair play points (4 yellow cards = -4 points vs 6 yellow cards = -6 points)
scenarios.why_complex: First time in World Cup history fair play tiebreaker was used; requires understanding 7-level tiebreaker hierarchy and weighted disciplinary scoring
scenarios.historical_significance: First team ever eliminated from World Cup via fair play tiebreaker

scenarios.title: 1994 World Cup Group E - Four Teams Identical
scenarios.scenario_question: All four teams finished with 4 points and 0 goal difference. How was the group decided?

logical_breakdown.step_3: Goals scored: Mexico 3, Ireland 2, Italy 2, Norway 1
logical_breakdown.step_5: Ireland vs Italy still tied (both 2 goals)

scenarios.answer: Mexico 1st (3 goals), Ireland 2nd (beat Italy H2H), Italy 3rd (lost to Ireland), Norway 4th (1 goal)
scenarios.why_complex: Only group in World Cup history where all 4 teams had identical points AND goal difference; required multi-step tiebreaker with H2H for subset of teams

scenarios.title: 1996-97 English Third Division Championship
scenarios.scenario_question: Both teams finished on 87 points. Who won the championship?

logical_breakdown.step_2: Football League rule (1992-1999): Goals scored BEFORE goal difference
logical_breakdown.step_5: Note: Fulham had better GD (34 vs 33)

scenarios.answer: Wigan Athletic won the championship despite having inferior goal difference (+33 vs +34) because temporary Football League rules (1992-1999) prioritized goals scored over goal difference
scenarios.why_complex: Counter-intuitive: team conceding 13 more goals won title; only true under specific 7-year rule window; under standard rules Fulham would be champions
scenarios.historical_significance: Only time in English football history a team won championship with inferior goal difference to rival on same points

scenarios.title: 1963-64 Serie A Championship Playoff
scenarios.scenario_question: Inter had more wins (23 vs 22) and better goal difference (+33 vs +36). Who won the Scudetto?
scenarios.answer: Bologna won the championship via playoff match (2-0) despite Inter having more wins and Inter having just won the European Cup 11 days prior
scenarios.why_complex: Only playoff in Serie A history to decide Scudetto; team with more wins and European Cup triumph loses; demonstrates how different eras had different tiebreaker systems

scenarios.title: Liverpool 2005-06 Champions League Qualification Crisis

context.issue: Liverpool won 2004-05 UCL but finished 5th in Premier League
context.problem: England had 4 UCL spots; Everton finished 4th
context.conflict: Title holder should defend but exceeded association limit

scenarios.scenario_question: Liverpool won the Champions League but finished 5th in the league. Everton finished 4th. Who qualifies for the Champions League?

logical_breakdown.step_1: Pre-existing rule: Top 4 in league qualify
logical_breakdown.step_2: Association limit: Max 4 teams per country
logical_breakdown.step_4: UEFA grants one-off exception: 5 English teams allowed
logical_breakdown.step_5: Conditions on Liverpool: Start from 1st Qualifying Round, no country protection
logical_breakdown.step_6: Result: Liverpool qualifies through 3 qualifying rounds
logical_breakdown.step_7: Everton eliminated in qualifying (lost to Villarreal)
logical_breakdown.step_8: Only 4 English teams reached group stage anyway

scenarios.answer: Both qualified initially (UEFA exception), but Liverpool had to start from First Qualifying Round. Everton (4th place) entered later but was eliminated. This led to permanent rule change: title holders now automatically qualify.
scenarios.why_complex: Multiple conflicting rule systems (domestic vs European vs association limits); unprecedented scenario; led to permanent regulation change (now codified that title holder auto-qualifies even if 5th team from country)

scenarios.title: 1996-97 EFL Playoff Away Goals Complexity
scenarios.competition: English Football League First Division Play-Off Semi-Final

second_leg.score: Ipswich Town 2-2 Sheffield United (after extra time)

scenarios.scenario_question: Aggregate is 3-3 after extra time. Who advances?

logical_breakdown.step_3: Away goals: Ipswich 1 (at Sheffield), Sheffield 2 (at Ipswich)
logical_breakdown.step_4: Sheffield United advances on away goals

scenarios.answer: Sheffield United advances 3-3 on aggregate, winning on away goals (2-1) despite not winning either leg
scenarios.why_complex: Team advances without winning either match; must track home/away context for each goal; extra time complicates matters; led to rule abolition in 1999-2000

scenarios.title: 2005 UEFA Cup Away Goals in Extra Time
scenarios.scenario_question: AZ wins second leg 3-2 in extra time. Aggregate is 4-4. Who advances?

logical_breakdown.step_2: AZ away goals: 1 (Landzaat in first leg)
logical_breakdown.step_3: Sporting away goals: 2 (Liedson 44' + Garcia 121' in second leg)
logical_breakdown.step_4: Extra time goal counts as away goal

scenarios.answer: Sporting CP advances on away goals (2-1) despite AZ winning the second leg 3-2 and scoring in extra time. Garcia's 121st minute header counted as an away goal.
scenarios.why_complex: Team loses on the pitch but advances; extra time goals count as away goals but home team has no chance to score away; AZ scored first in extra time but last-second equalizer eliminated them; exemplifies why away goals rule was eventually abolished

scenarios.title: UEFA Coefficient Portugal vs Russia

coefficient_calculation.formula: Total club points / Number of participating clubs

scenarios.scenario_question: Russia was 6th with 50.549 points, Portugal 7th with 48.232 points. How did Portugal overtake Russia?

logical_breakdown.step_5: Total swing: 6.217 points in Portugal's favor

scenarios.answer: Portugal gained 6th place through consistent mid-range performances (10.3 pts) while Russia's disastrous 2019-20 season (4.666 pts) combined with dropping a strong 2014-15 season created a 6.217-point swing

implications.6th_place: 3 UCL spots with 2 automatic group stage entries
implications.7th_place: 2 UCL spots with no automatic group stage entry

scenarios.why_complex: Requires understanding 5-year rolling windows, decimal precision to 3 places, club-to-country aggregation, and cascading effects of one season's performance on multi-year rankings

expected_model_capabilities: Apply rules in correct sequential order
Construct mini-tables from raw match data

metadata.author: Claude Code
metadata.purpose: Evaluation dataset for testing logical reasoning on complex sporting scenarios
